0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Contraception: vaginal film, insert 5 to 15 minutes VAGINALLY prior to intercourse; effective for 2 hours
  • Contraception: vaginal foam, 1 applicatorful inserted VAGINALLY immediately or up to 1 hr prior to intercourse
  • Contraception: vaginal gel, 1 applicatorful inserted VAGINALLY immediately or up to 1 hr prior to intercourse
  • Contraception: vaginal jelly, used with diaphragm, 1 applicatorful applied to dome cup of diaphragm and round rim prior to insertion up to 6 hr prior to intercourse; leave diaphragm in place for 6 hr after intercourse, then remove
  • Contraception: vaginal jelly, used with condom, 1 applicatorful inserted VAGINALLY within 1 hr of intercourse
  • Contraception: vaginal sponge, 1 sponge inserted VAGINALLY immediately or up to 24 hr prior to intercourse; leave sponge in place for 6 hr after intercourse, remove within 30 hr of insertion
  • Contraception: vaginal suppository, 1 suppository inserted VAGINALLY; wait 10 to 15 minutes but no more than 1 hr before intercourse

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• does not protect against HIV (AIDS) or other sexually transmitted diseases
  • can irritate the vagina and rectum, which may increase the risk of contracting HIV (AIDS) from an infected partner
  • patients who should avoid pregnancy; spermicides are not 100% effective

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Reproductive:Irritation of penis, Discomfort, Vaginal discomfort, Vaginal irritation, Vaginal pain
Serious
Immunologic:AIDS

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    avoid douching for 6 hr after intercourse
  • Vaginal
    • (film, foam, gel/jelly, suppository) dose/application should be repeated for each subsequent act of intercourse
    • (foam) shake well before use
    • (jelly, suppository) may be used with other methods (condoms, diaphragms)
    • (sponge) wet the sponge thoroughly with clean water prior to insertion; do not rinse the light foam or "suds" that appear
    • (sponge) wait 6 hours after last intercourse before removing; do not leave in longer than 30 hours

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• local irritation (patient or partner)
  • signs of infection (eg, toxic shock syndrome)

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Conceptrol
    Vaginal Gel/Jelly: 4 %
  • Delfen Foam
    Vaginal Foam: 12.5 %
  • Encare
    Vaginal Suppository: 100 MG
  • Gynol II
    Vaginal Gel/Jelly: 2 %
  • Today Sponge
    Vaginal Sponge: 1000 MG
  • VCF Contraceptive
    • Vaginal Film: 28 %
    • Vaginal Foam: 12.5 %

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient to practice safe sex. Drug does not prevent disease transmission.
  • This drug may cause contact dermatitis, irritation of penis, or vaginal irritation.
  • This drug is available in multiple brand names with varying properties by brand. Instruct patient to follow administration instructions specific to the prescribed brand with regards to use and timing.
